column4: What is the difference between manual and static in /etc/network/interfaces?  For example, I could say, "iface eth0 inet manual" or I could say, "iface eth0 inet static" and both will work...
manual takes no options. It's used for bonding and/or bridge devices.
Any idea where I can find more information about this?  Like a manpage or something?
It's one of those things I've done for years but never understood why…  I'm simply not satisfied with doing something and not knowing why :)
